Teaching

Discover our innovative approach to engineering education through hands-on learning and real-world applications.

All Courses

Explore our comprehensive curriculum designed to provide students with both theoretical knowledge and practical experience.

ENGR 2103 Credits

Engineering Statics

Fundamental principles of statics and their application to engineering problems.

CEE 3183 Credits

Environmental Water Quality

Study of water quality parameters and environmental monitoring techniques.

CEE 4004 Credits

Capstone Design: Lab-scale Model for Wetlands

Comprehensive design project focusing on constructed wetland systems.

CEE 3503 Credits

Construction Materials

Properties and applications of construction materials in engineering projects.

ENGR 3203 Credits

Renewable Energy Systems

Design and implementation of sustainable energy solutions.

CEE 4154 Credits

Water Treatment Design

Advanced water treatment system design and optimization.

Teaching Philosophy

Our approach to engineering education emphasizes hands-on learning, real-world applications, and student-centered experiences.
